Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Pastor David Wright, Grace Tabernacle Christian Center, 1745 Pacific Street, Brooklyn, NY 11213.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Vann.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Pastor David Wright, Grace Tabernacle Christian Center, 1745 Pacaific Strret, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11213.


Council Member Vann moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 14, 2009 be adopted as printed by Council Member Vacca.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Vacca moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 14, 2009 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Koppell:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 5693 Riverdale Avenue, Community Board 8, Application 20095681 TCX shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 5693 Riverdale Avenue,  Bronx (20095681TCX)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon Governor Paterson to restore proposed cuts of $53 million to CUNY senior colleges, $9.9 million to CUNY community colleges, $90 million to SUNY schools, and $26.2 million to TAP.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Governor Paterson to restore proposed cuts of $53 million to CUNY senior colleges, $9.9 million to CUNY community colleges, $90 million to SUNY schools, and $26.2 million to TAP.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to the budgets of the Public Advocate, Comptroller, Conflicts of Interest Board, and the Civilian Complaint Review Board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Budgets of the Public Advocate, Comptroller, Conflicts of Interest Board, and the Civilian Complaint Review Board.

Items.Title: Resolution praising the contributions of the annual Bronx College Fair Day in providing valuable information and assistance to young people seeking to obtain a college education.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Praising the contributions of the annual Bronx College Fair Day

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the fluoridation of water.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Fluoridation of water.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to amend Article 2-AA of the State Banking Law to mandate that any ATM terminal operating in the State must be outfitted with the “Reverse PIN System.”
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Amend Article 2-AA of the State Banking Law to mandate that any ATM terminal operating in the State must be outfitted with the “Reverse PIN System.”

Items.Title:
Communication from the Office of the City Clerk – Submitting the Certificate of the swearing in of Ydanis A. Rodriguez, as the new Council Member of the 10th Council District, New York County.

THE CITY CLERK AND CLERK OF THE COUNCIL PERFORMS THE FORMAL CEREMONY OF THE ELECTED COUNCIL MEMBER YDANIS A. RODRIGUEZ TAKING HIS OATH OF OFFICE.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Certificate of the swearing in of Ydanis A. Rodriguez, as the new Council Member of the 10th Council District, NY County.

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 800 Seventh Avenue, Community Board 5, Application 20105193 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, Trel Restaurant, Inc, Manhattan (20105193TCM)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point, the City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) performed the formal ceremonial swearing in of newly elected Council Member Ydanis A. Rodriguez.  Council Member Rodriguez took the Oath of Office to be the Council Member representing the 10th Council District (Manhattan).
